resources.string: Alzheimer\'s Awareness Quiz
Welcome to the \nAlzheimer\'s Awareness Quiz!
You will be asked 10 questions about the signs and symptoms of alzheimer\'s disease. \nAnswer each question to the best of your knowledge. \nYour responses will be scored at the end.

DISCLAIMER \nThis app was created to raise awareness and direct those that suspect they or their loved one may be suffering from the early stages of alzheimer\'s disease to more information from the Alzheimer\'s Association. This quiz does not diagnose or treat any illness and is not endorsed by any medical professional or the Alzheimer\'s Association. Materials from alz.org® are used with permission by the Alzheimer\'s Association.
Please Enter Your Name
Hello,
Submit Name
Logo of Alzheimer\'s Association
None of these.
Submit Answer
You must choose at least one option.
Question 1
Do you or your love one experience any of these examples of memory loss that disrupt daily life?\nCheck all that apply:
Forgets recently learned information.
Forgets important dates or events.
Asks for the same information over and over.
Increased need to rely on memory aids or family members for things once handled by self.
Sometimes forgetting names or appointments, but remembering them later can be a typical age-related change.
Question 2
Do you or your loved one experience challenges in planning or solving problems?\nCheck all that apply:
Changes in your/their ability to develop and follow a plan.
Changes in your/their ability to work with numbers.
Has trouble following a familiar recipe or keeping track of monthly bills.
Has difficulty concentrating and takes much longer to do things than you/they did before.
Making occasional errors when balancing a checkbook can be a typical age-related change.
Question 3
Do you or your loved one have difficulty completing familiar tasks at home, at work, or at leisure?\nCheck all that apply:
Finds it hard to complete daily tasks.
Has trouble driving to a familiar location.
Has trouble managing a budget at work.
Has trouble remembering the rules of a favorite game.
Occasionally needing help to use the settings on a microwave or to record a television show can be a typical age-related change.
Question 4
Do you or your loved one experience confusion with time or place?\nCheck all that apply:
Loses track of dates and seasons.
Loses track of the passage of time.
Has trouble understanding something if it is not happening immediately.
Sometimes forget where you/they are or how you/they got there.
Getting confused about the day of the week but figuring it out later can be a typical age-related change.
Question 5
Do you or your loved on experience trouble understanding visual images and spacial relationships?\nCheck all that apply:
Has vision problems.
Has difficulty reading.
Has difficulty determining color or contrast.
Has difficulty judging distance/problems with driving.
Vision changes related to cataracts can be a typical age-related change.
Question 6
Do you or your loved one have new problems with words in speaking or writing? Check all that apply:
Has trouble following or joining a conversation.
Stops in the middle of a conversation and has no idea how to continue or you/they repeat themselves
Struggles with vocabulary/has problems finding the right word.
Calls things by the wrong name.
Sometimes having trouble finding the right word can be a typical age-related change.
Question 7
Do you or your loved one misplace things and lose the ability to retrace steps?\nCheck all that apply:
Puts things in unusual places.
Loses things with increasing frequency.
Unable to go back over your/their steps to find lost items.
Accuses others of stealing.
Misplacing things from time to time and retracing steps to find them can be a typical age-related change.
Question 8
Do you or your loved one have decreased or poor judgement?\nCheck all that apply:
Changes in judgment or decision-making.
Uses poor judgment when dealing with money.
Pays less attention to grooming.
Pays less attention to keeping yourself/themself clean
Making a bad decision once in a while can be a typical age-related change.
Question 9
Are you or your loved one withdrawing from work or social activities?\nCheck all that apply:
Starting to remove yourself/themself from hobbies, social activities, work projects or sports.
Has trouble keeping up with a favorite sports team.
Has trouble remembering how to complete a favorite hobby.
Avoids being social.
Sometimes feeling weary of work, family and social obligations can be a typical age-related change.
Question 10
Have you or your loved one experienced any changes in mood and personality?\nCheck all that apply:
Becomes confused or suspicious.
Becomes depressed, fearful or anxious.
Is easily upset at home, at work, and with friends.
Is easily upset in places where they are out of their comfort zone.
Developing very specific ways of doing things and becoming irritable when a routine is disrupted can be a typical age-related change.
Thank you for taking the\nAlzheimer\'s Awareness Quiz
Your score is:
out of 40
A high score could mean that you or your loved one is experiencing the early warning signs of Alzheimer\'s disease.
Would you like to email your results?
Yes
No
No email will be generated.

Go to alz.org®

\n\nThe Alzheimer\'s Association is not responsible for information or advice provided by others, including information on websites that link to Association sites and on third party sites to which the Association links.
